info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 5:13PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bladen and northwestern Columbus Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 513 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Southeastern Community College, or near Whiteville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Whiteville, Chadbourn, Lisbon, Cherry Grove, Lagoon, Sidney, Elkton, Emerson, Southeastern Community College, Clarendon, Williams, Hallsboro, Brunswick, Clarkton, White Lake and Columbus Regional Healthcare System. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern North Carolina.
